result.execSummary:
The defendant Spensor J. KNITTER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Oxycodone, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: under the Huber Law, consecutive to the sentence defendant is presently serving.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.   
State moves to delete the penalty enhancer on count 1, second or subsequent offense.  Motion granted.  
Count 1 - Possess Oxycodone - Guilty plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, placing prescription drug in public place.   Motion granted.   Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for ninety (90) days, under the Huber Law, consecutive to the sentence defendant is presently serving.    
Defendant must submit DNA sample.   
$518.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 01-10-17 or 10 days jail.    
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 03-17-16 at 1:30 p.m.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for  12-10-15 at 2:30 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 11-10-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
RE:  Possess Oxycodone-2nd or subsequent, on 10-11-15.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess schedule I or II narcotic while in jail.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-02-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody serving a sentence.
Minutes.
